Lambanog.name: Lambanog
Lambanog.menudesc:
A spirit made from distilled coconut sap, common in Southeast Asia.
 Also known as coconut vodka or wine. 40%-45% ABV.

Tuak.name: Tuak
Tuak.menudesc: A traditional rice wine indigenous to the Bornean region. 15-18% ABV.
Tuak.desc: A primitive wine, said to have kept the ones that brew it drunk '100 out of 365 days'.

Water.name: Water
Water.desc:
Plain ol' drinking water, straight from the tap.
 A timeless classic.

SparklingWater.name: Sparkling Water
SparklingWater.desc: For those of you who think plain old drinking water is just too boring.

Sangria.name: Sangria
Sangria.menudesc:
A fruity wine punch of Spanish origin.
 Mainly red wine and chopped fruit.
Sangria.desc:
Technically this is just a liquid and alcoholic fruit salad.
 Cheers to your healthy diet.

Aviation.name: Aviation
Aviation.menudesc: 3:1:1:1 Gin, Maraschino liqueur, creme de violette and lemon juice.
Aviation.desc: For those who aim high and achieve great things.

MoscowMule.name: Moscow Mule
MoscowMule.menudesc: 6:3:1 Ginger beer, vodka, lime juice, all served in a copper mug.
MoscowMule.desc: A cocktail that in 1941 solved the problem of three unsuccessful business people: a copper mug salesman, a barkeep, and a vodka distiller.

Deathintheafternoon.name: Death in the Afternoon
Deathintheafternoon.menudesc: 9:2 Champagne and Absinthe in a champagne flute, garnished with a lemon peel
Deathintheafternoon.desc:
Invented by Ernest Hemingway, and if followed his drinking instructions, which say to drink three to five glasses, may lead to an early retirement from this world. 
 It is unclear however, whether that would happen in the afternoon.

LycheeMartini.name: Lychee Martini
LycheeMartini.desc: A martini that tastes like lychees. Simple enough.

MulledWine.name: Mulled Wine
MulledWine.menudesc: Red wine mixed with a cocktail of spices and served either hot or warm, alcoholic or non-alcoholic.
MulledWine.desc: Warms the soul like nothing else.

SingaporeSling.name: Singapore Sling
SingaporeSling.menudesc: 2:1:1:1 Pineapple juice, gin, cherry liqueur and lime juice.
SingaporeSling.desc: Originally called a Gin Sling, this classic hails from as far back as 1915.

HairOfTheDog.name: Hair of the Dog
HairOfTheDog.desc: Just like healing a dog's bite with dog hair, healing hangovers can be done with more alcohol. And this one's perfect for the job.

TequilaSunrise.name: Tequila Sunrise
TequilaSunrise.menudesc: A sweet mix of Tequila, orange juice, and grenadine syrup.
TequilaSunrise.desc: Some people say it gets its name because it looks like a sunrise. I prefer to think it means I get to share your company until then.

StrawberryDaquiri.name: Strawberry Daquiri
StrawberryDaquiri.menudesc: A daiquiri with strawberries added to the mix.
StrawberryDaquiri.desc: Perfect for beating the summer heat.

Margarita.name: Margarita
Margarita.menudesc: 2:1:1 Tequila, Triple Sec and lime juice.
Margarita.desc: So what's a cougar like you doing here?

JackFrost.name: Jack Frost
JackFrost.menudesc: Vodka, pineapple juice, cream of coconut, blue curacao, coconut, all blended with ice.
JackFrost.desc: The Pina Colada's winter version. Tropical, yet festive.

SexOnTheBeach.name: Sex on the Beach
SexOnTheBeach.menudesc: 2:2:1 Vodka, cranberry juice and Peach Schnapps, topped with orange juice.
SexOnTheBeach.desc: Not a good idea. It's all coarse, and rough, and irritating. And it gets everywhere.

Mojito.name: Mojito
Mojito.menudesc: Rum, lime juice, brown sugar, and mint, topped with soda.
Mojito.desc:
One of those cocktails that takes forever to make, but people order them in gargantuan quantities anyway.
 Be sure to leave a generous tip.

VirginMojito.name: Virgin Mojito
VirginMojito.menudesc: Lime juice, brown sugar, and mint, topped with soda.
VirginMojito.desc: It's a mojito, but named and served just for you.

RoyRogers.name: Roy Rogers
RoyRogers.menudesc: Coca-Cola with grenadine syrup, garnished with a maraschino cherry
RoyRogers.desc: Not named after Dread Pirate Rogers, but after a famous spaghetti western actor, this one is perfect when you need your wits about before a shootout.

Cinderella.name: Cinderella
Cinderella.menudesc: Equal parts of lemon, orange and pineapple juice, with a dash of grenadine and topped with ginger ale.
Cinderella.desc: Don't leave in a hurry, lest you forget your footwear.

WhiteRussian.name: White Russian
WhiteRussian.desc:
Made popular by The Dude in The Big Lebowski movie. 
 If you don't like it, then well, that's just, like, your opinion, man.

BlackRussian.name: Black Russian
BlackRussian.desc: Somewhat of a rarity, Black Russian is a mix of vodka and coffee liqueur, mostly in a 5:3 ratio.

OldFashioned.name: Old Fashioned
OldFashioned.menudesc: 12:2:1 Bourbon, sugar syrup, squeezed orange peel, and Angostura bitters.
OldFashioned.desc: Reminiscent of the times when cocktails were simply alcohol with anything fruity over ice.

WhiskeySour.name: Whiskey Sour
WhiskeySour.menudesc: 4:2:1 Whiskey, lemon juice, and sugar syrup.
WhiskeySour.desc: The original 'sour'. Like other sours, it's made up by 4:2:1 of whiskey, lemon juice, and sugar syrup. Add an egg white into the mix for some frothy texture.

Whisky.name: Whisky
Whisky.menudesc: A spirit made from fermented grain mash, aged in wooden casks. 40–68% ABV.
Whisky.desc: Modern spelling of uisce beatha, Gaelic for 'water of life'. Because what would life be without a bit of whisky?

Manhattan.name: Manhattan
Manhattan.menudesc: 2:1 Rye and Sweet Vermouth, plus a few dashes of Angostura bitters.

BlackVelvet.name: Black Velvet
BlackVelvet.menudesc: A glass of Champagne poured into a perfect pint of Guinness.
BlackVelvet.desc: For when a pint of Guinness just isn't fancy enough for the occasion.

MintJulep.name: Mint Julep
MintJulep.menudesc: Bourbon, sugar syrup, and muddled mint leaves.
MintJulep.desc: An American classic, famously served by Daisy in The Great Gastby.

BloodyMary.name: Bloody Mary
BloodyMary.menudesc: Vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice, salt, pepper, tabasco, and Worcestershire sauce, garnished with a stalk of celery.
BloodyMary.desc: A breakfast cocktail perfect for jumpstarting your day.

Screwdriver.name: Screwdriver
Screwdriver.desc: Named after NYC construction workers using screwdrivers to stir their orange-juice-carton-smuggled vodka, this one is as simple as it gets.

Daiquiri.name: Daiquiri
Daiquiri.menudesc: 4:2:1 Rum, lime juice, and sugar syrup.
Daiquiri.desc: Famously drunk by Ernest Hemingway, a Daiquiri could also be called a 'Rum Sour', but that doesn't sound quite as catchy now, does it?

Bacardi.name: Bacardi
Bacardi.desc: Made by Bacardi in an attempt to popularise their ethanol.

DirtyMartini.name: Dirty Martini
DirtyMartini.menudesc: 6:1:1 Vodka, Dry Vermouth, and olive brine.
DirtyMartini.desc: Unlike its pornstar sister, Dirty Martini isn't named as an innuendo, but because of how the olive juice affects its opacity. Served with an olive garnish.

Vesper.name: Vesper
Vesper.desc:
Shaken, not stirred. Invented by Ian Fleming, and popularised by his character James Bond.
 Served with a twisted lemon peel garnish.

DarkNStormy.name: Dark'N'Stormy
DarkNStormy.menudesc: 7:4 Ginger beer and dark rum, bitters to taste.
DarkNStormy.desc: Dark rum, stormy ginger beer. Perfect for sailors and pirates alike.

Godfather.name: Godfather
Godfather.desc: Referencing the classic movie, the Godfather is an equal split between Amaretto (Sicilian Mafia) and Bourbon (American Mafia). Served over ice.

Caipirinha.name: Caipirinha
Caipirinha.desc:
'The countryside lady', Brazil's national cocktail. 
 Fica à vontade.

Gimlet.name: Gimlet
Gimlet.menudesc: 4:2:1 Gin, lime juice, and sugar syrup
Gimlet.desc: Could've called it a Gin Sour, but I suppose Gimlet does have a nice ring to it…

ShirleyTemple.name: Shirley Temple
ShirleyTemple.desc: Just like its namesake, this mocktail is quite sweet.

HairyNavel.name: Hairy Navel
HairyNavel.menudesc: 1:1:2 Peach Schnapps, Vodka, and pulpy orange juice.
HairyNavel.desc: Just order a Fuzzy Navel instead.

FuzzyNavel.name: Fuzzy Navel
FuzzyNavel.menudesc: Equal parts Peach Schnapps, orange juice.
FuzzyNavel.desc: Just order a Hairy Navel instead.

SkinnyBitch.name: Skinny Bitch
SkinnyBitch.menudesc:
Vodka, soda water, and lime juice.
 Garnished with one lime wedge.
SkinnyBitch.desc: A favourite of calorie-cutting party goers and keto dieters everywhere.

Sidecar.name: Sidecar
Sidecar.desc:
Made of 5 parts Cognac, 2 parts Cointreau, and 2 parts lemon juice.
 As the Cointreau is the sidecar to the leading flavour of Cognac, it's unclear where lemon juice fits in this allegory.

Appletini.name: Appletini
Appletini.desc: Yet another Martini variation, with a fruity twist.

PinaColada.name: Pina Colada
PinaColada.menudesc: 3:1:1 Pinapple juice, white rum and coconut milk.
PinaColada.desc: We offer umbrellas for customers in this establishment.

HotToddy.name: Hot Toddy
HotToddy.menudesc: Lemon honey tea, but also Whisky.
HotToddy.desc: For the times when a cup of tea just needs a bit of an extra punch.

Wassail.name: Wassail
Wassail.menudesc: Mulled cider punch, served nice and hot.
Wassail.desc:
From the Anglo-Saxon _wes hál_, meaning 'be healthy', this traditional English drink is perfect for anyone wishing to celebrate the Yuletide or harrass the local Lordship.
 Drinc hál!

ScreamingOrgasm.name: Screaming Orgasm
ScreamingOrgasm.menudesc:
Equal parts Vodka, Kahlua, Amaretto, cream liqueur and milk.
 It's a mystery where this thick white cocktail got its name.
ScreamingOrgasm.desc:
We know you've never had one, so might as well get one here.
 Just don't spill any of that stuff on the counter.

TomandJerry.name: Tom and Jerry
TomandJerry.menudesc: 1:1: Dark rum, brandy and Cognac topped with hot milk.
TomandJerry.desc:
No, it's not named after a cartoon.
 Introduced as a way of popularising his book, Pierce Egan put a spin on the classic egnogg recipe by adding brandy to it.

NoName.name: No Name
NoName.menudesc: 4:1 rum and honey. Cinnamon sticks to taste.
NoName.desc:
Uniquely crafted to go with a cigar, this one consists of 4 parts of rum, 1 part of honey, some cinnamon sticks, all put into a shaker. 
 It doesn't have a name; the customer names it.

A1.name: A1
A1.menudesc: 6:4:1 Gin, Grand Marnier, lemon juice with a dash of grenadine
A1.desc: A cocktail that was named in such a way that in any alphabetically sorted book it would be on the first page.

LastKiss.name: Last Kiss
LastKiss.menudesc: 6:2:1:1:1:1 Light rum, gin, brandy, dry vermouth, lemon juice and sugar syrup.
LastKiss.desc: What can I say? We may not meet again, so let me give you one Last Kiss.

RustyNail.name: Rusty Nail
RustyNail.desc: You won't need a tetanus shot after this one.

GinFizz.name: Gin Fizz
GinFizz.menudesc: 2:1:1 Gin, lime juice and sugar syrup, shaken with an egg white and topped with soda.
GinFizz.desc: It's a Gimlet but with soda and egg whites.

Bannockburn.name: Bannockburn
Bannockburn.menudesc: It's a Bloody Mary with whiskey.
Bannockburn.desc:
Scottish people put their own spin on Bloody Mary.
 They replaced vodka with whiskey and renamed it after one of the their most impressive victories over the English.

Sledgehammer.name: Sledgehammer
Sledgehammer.menudesc: 9:2:1 Vodka, Orange juice and lime juice.
Sledgehammer.desc: True to its name, will get you smashed right and proper.

Brandy.name: Brandy
Brandy.menudesc: A spirit produced by distilling wine. 40% ABV.
Brandy.desc: The preferred drink of cigar-puffing suits and afro-american rappers alike.

Gin.name: Gin
Gin.menudesc: A grain spirit whose characteristic flavour comes from juniper berries. 40% ABV.
Gin.desc: Gin, sans tonic. Herbal and piney in flavour, thanks to the juniper berries present in most traditional recipes.

Rum.name: Rum
Rum.menudesc: A distilled alcoholic drink made by fermenting then distilling sugarcane molasses or sugarcane juice, which is then aged in oak barrels. Has famous associations with piracy. 40-45% ABV.
Rum.desc:
Rum, the one thing that both the Navy and pirates can bond over.
Thanks to being made with sugarcane, you can always count on a hint of sweetness within.

Tequila.name: Tequila
Tequila.menudesc: A spirit made from the blue agave plant. Served neat as a shot with salt and lime. 35-55% ABV.

Vodka.name: Vodka
Vodka.menudesc: Water and ethanol. A spirit made from literally anything that could be fermented to make alcohol, but typically grain, less commonly potatoes. 40% ABV.
Vodka.desc: Everyone likes water, so why not try some water with alcohol?

Absinthe.name: Absinthe
Absinthe.menudesc: 'Green fairy'. A distilled, highly alcoholic spirit that is bitter and anise-flavoured, made mostly from the leaves and flowers of wormwood. 60-80% ABV.
Absinthe.desc:
Ah, 'la fée verte', our green fairy that was a common sight among 19th century Parisians.
 Beware her grasp; absinthe is quite strong.

Everclear.name: Everclear
Everclear.menudesc: A distilled spirit that has a notorious reputation for its high alcohol content, up to 95% ABV. Typically mixed with other ingredients to create cocktails, or with water to create vodka.
Everclear.desc:
You've tried water with alcohol, now try alcohol with water.
 Guaranteed to fuck you up.

Lager.name: Lager
Lager.menudesc:
The most widely consumed and commercially available style of beer.
 Easily recognizable by its golden colour and light flavour.

WheatBeer.name: Wheat Beer
WheatBeer.menudesc: One of the oldest styles of beer still in existence today, brewed with anywhere from 30 to 70% wheat in the grain mix.

EnglishBitter.name: English Bitter
EnglishBitter.menudesc:
Contrary to its name, this beer won't make you gag from the taste.
 A light and 'sessionable' beer, thanks to its comparatively low alcohol content.

India Pale Ale.name: India Pale Ale
India Pale Ale.menudesc:
A variant of the Pale Ale that has an increased hops content.
 Was a result of British brewers looking for a way to ship pale ale to soldiers stationed in India without the drink spoiling during the voyage.

Porter.name: Porter
Porter.menudesc: A dark style of beer developed in London that has flavors and aromas of coffee, chocolate and toast.

Stout.name: Stout
Stout.menudesc: A stronger, 'stouter' version of the Porter, popularized by Guinness.
Stout.desc: Be honest with yourself and just call it a Guinness.

Lambic.name: Lambic
Lambic.menudesc: A Belgian beer. Its most popular variant is Kriek, which is brewed with sour cherries.
Lambic.desc: Some people think this tastes like cough syrup. Those people are wrong.

Cider.name: Cider
Cider.menudesc: Fermented apple juice. Amber to gold sour-sweet nectar.
Cider.desc: For when you want to drink apple juice but also want to get plastered.

ColdBrew.name: Cold Brew
ColdBrew.menudesc: Low acidity dark roasted coffee brewed overnight & served over water & ice.

NitroColdBrew.name: Nitro Cold Brew
NitroColdBrew.menudesc: Cold brewed coffee infused with nitrogen for a naturally sweet flavor and cascading, velvety crema.

IcedAmericano.name: Iced Americano
IcedAmericano.menudesc: Two shots of espresso coffee + iced water for a long lasting drink.

IcedCoffee.name: Iced Coffee
IcedCoffee.menudesc: Freshly brewed coffee in the roast of your choice served over ice.

BrewedCoffee.name: Plain Hot Coffee
BrewedCoffee.menudesc: Freshly brewed coffee in the roast of your choice - flavoring, sugar, cream all optional.

Macchiato.name: Macchiato
Macchiato.menudesc: Espresso & a small amount of foamed milk.

FlatWhite.name: Flat White
FlatWhite.menudesc: Two shots of espresso coffee (blonde or dark roast) with steam milk microfoam. Velvety luxury.

Cappuccino.name: Cappucino
Cappuccino.menudesc: Two shots of espresso coffee, with milk of your choice (almond, coconut, regular), topped with microfoam.

Americano.name: Americano
Americano.menudesc: Two shots of espresso coffee + water for a long lasting drink served hot.

Mocha.name: Mocha
Mocha.menudesc: Espresso and hot milk with cocoa powder + sugar.

Latte.name: Latte
Latte.menudesc: 2 shots of espresso with steamed milk.

SpicyWater.name: Spicy Water
SpicyWater.menudesc: Literally just water and vodka. Toss a lime wedge in if you're adventurous.
SpicyWater.desc: It ain’t fancy, but you're here to get drunk, and it does the job.

Kvass.name: Kvass
Kvass.menudesc:
A fermented beverage, not unlike beer, made from rye bread that is enjoyed as a summertime drink in many Slavic countries.
 Mildly alcoholic, around 0.5-1% ABV, but classified as a non-alcoholic beverage nonetheless.
Kvass.desc: Delicious and thirst-quenching bread juice. Tastes a bit like raisins.

Pilsner.name: Pilsner
Pilsner.menudesc: A style of beer invented by a German brewer in 1843 in the city of Pilsen, characterised by its bittersweet earthy taste, bright gold colour and clear liquid.
Pilsner.desc: Hoppy and delightfully bitter. Go big or go home.

EarlGrey.name: Earl Grey Tea
EarlGrey.menudesc: Black tea with a splash of bergamot (orange) oil infused in the leaves.
EarlGrey.desc: Nice, wholesome, and Grey. Sounds like good weather.

GreenTea.name: Green Tea
GreenTea.menudesc: Camellia sinensis leaves oxidized much less than the black variant.
GreenTea.desc: Not actually green most of the time.

EnglishBreakfast.name: English Breakfast Tea
EnglishBreakfast.menudesc:
A blend of black teas, commonly Assam, Ceylon, and Kenyan, traditionally served as part of the full English breakfast.
 Goes well with milk and sugar.

Darjeeling.name: Darjeeling Tea
Darjeeling.menudesc: A famous tea grown in West Bengal, India. Brews thin and light with a floral aroma.

SilverNeedle.name: Silver Needle Tea
SilverNeedle.menudesc: A prized white tea produced in Fujian Province, China. Sweet and delicate.

Caf\u00e9ConLeche.name: Café Con Leche
Caf\u00e9ConLeche.menudesc: A traditional beverage of Spanish and Latin American origin that consists of strong and bold dark-roasted coffee (usually espresso) mixed with scalded milk in approximately a 1:1 ratio. Sugar or sweetener is added according to taste. Comes with two variants, both with more amounts of milk. Café Con Leche en Vaso (Coffee with Milk in Cup) or Café Con Leche de Desayuno (Breakfast Coffee with Milk).

Espresso.name: Espresso
Espresso.menudesc: Coffee made by forcing high pressure water through finely ground beans.

CorpseReviver2.name: Corpse Reviver No. 2
CorpseReviver2.menudesc: 4:3:3:3 of Gin, Triple Sec, Lemon juice and dry vermouth with few dashes of absinthe.
CorpseReviver2.desc:
For when you really need to be jolted awake. 
Hey, you. You are finally awake...

Mead.name: Mead
Mead.menudesc: Fermented honey with water, sometimes with fruits, spices, grains or hops. Colour varies by honey type. 3.5% ABV and upwards.
Mead.desc: The drink of Gods and Vikings, perfect for those days when you have Dragons to slay.

BlackSambuca.name: Black Sambuca
BlackSambuca.menudesc: An anise-flavored liqueur of Italian origin. 38% ABV.
BlackSambuca.desc: When you 'n' the lads are getting a bit lairy and you need yourself a nice shot to ripen the mood

DrinkName.name: Solo
DrinkName.desc: For when you and the lads want some classic Norwegian goodness

BeesKnees.name: Bee's Knees
BeesKnees.menudesc: 8:6:6 parts of gin, honey, and lemon juice
BeesKnees.desc:
A cocktail from the Prohibition era.
The name meant 'the best'. Just like you.

WhiteLady.name: White Lady
WhiteLady.menudesc: 4:3:2 parts gin, Triple Sec and lemon juice
WhiteLady.desc: Everyone can drink it regardless of skin colour, though maybe refrain if you are named Karen.

TheLastWord.name: The Last Word
TheLastWord.menudesc: 1:1:1:1 parts gin, lime juice, green Chartreuse, and maraschino liquer.
TheLastWord.desc: Yours, until the last flame dies and all words have been spoken.

SufferingBastard.name: Suffering Bastard
SufferingBastard.menudesc: 8:2:2:1 parts ginger beer, gin, bourbon and lime juice, with a dash of Angostura bitters.
SufferingBastard.desc: You did ask for the manager, right?

MotorOilShot.name: Motor Oil Shot
MotorOilShot.menudesc: 1:1:1:1 parts Jägermeister, peppermint schnapps, goldschläger and coconut rum.
MotorOilShot.desc: Feeling old, cranky or mouldy? Something grinding your gears? What you need is a glass of the finest motor oil in this establishment. Fear not, this one is engineered uniquely to lubricate your inner workings.

Ramune.name: Ramune (ラムネ)
Ramune.menudesc: Carbonated water, sugar, citric acid, and lemon flavoring, served in a glass codd-neck bottle sealed with a marble.
Ramune.desc: The quintessential Japanese summer drink. You can't go wrong with a bottle of faintly sweet, fizzy marble soda on a hot and humid day.

PanGalacticGargleBlaster.name: Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster
PanGalacticGargleBlaster.menudesc: 1:1:5 bourbon, peach schnapps, and orange juice, with a splash of blue curacao liqueur. Garnish with a citrus twist and possibly an olive.
PanGalacticGargleBlaster.desc: Like having your brains smashed out by a slice of lemon wrapped round a large gold brick. Don't panic, it's mostly harmless.

Mugicha.name: Mugicha (麦茶)
Mugicha.menudesc: Made with roasted barley grains, often served chilled with ice.
Mugicha.desc: The perfect accompaniment to the sound of cicadas on a hot summer day.

IchigoMilk.name: Ichigo Milk (いちごミルク)
IchigoMilk.menudesc: Fresh milk blended with strawberry puree.
IchigoMilk.desc: Flows through the veins of cute anime girls, probably.

AppleJuice.name: Apple Juice
AppleJuice.desc: When you want a simple but tasteful drink without alcohol.

OrangeJuice.name: Orange Juice
OrangeJuice.desc: When you want a simple but tasteful drink without alcohol.

CreamSoda.name: Cream Soda (クリームソーダ)
CreamSoda.menudesc: Club soda mixed with melon syrup, topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a maraschino cherry
CreamSoda.desc: This fizzy emerald drink is a Japanese diner classic, and is well-loved by kids and adults alike.

MilkTea.name: Milk Tea(タピオカミルクティー)
MilkTea.menudesc: Black tea base mixed with sweetened condensed milk, served over chewy tapioca pearls.
MilkTea.desc: Sweet and creamy, complemented well by the soft, chewy texture of the tapioca pearls.

CocaCola.name: Coca Cola
CocaCola.desc: For when you need to satisfy that sugar rush and caffeine addiction

example.name: example
example.desc: Come up with an Eagles song for THIS one, Joe!

southside.name: Southside
southside.menudesc: 4:2:1 Gin, lime juice and sugar syrup, along with a sprig of mint. Shaken.
southside.desc:
People say the name comes from it being the favourite drink of the infamous Al Capone, the ruler of Chicago's South Side. 
For me, the minty sweet taste calms me when things go south. It's the drink that waits south side.
